name: WebRTC Video
description: Mattermost plugin for webRTC peer to peer video call.

settings_schema.header: The mattermost-webrtc-video plugin allows users to make P2P video calls.

settings.help_text: Signalhub is used for call signalling (incoming call, call received, call ended, etc.). Example: https://signalhub.example.com/

STUN server to use for calls, conforming to RFC 3489, RFC 5389, RFC 5780 and others. Enter as 'stun:<hostname>:<port>'. STUN server should usually have public IP address and is used for NAT traversal. Example: stun:stun.example.com:3498

TURN server to use for calls, conforming to RFC 5766, RFC 6062 and others. Enter as 'turn:<hostname>:<port>'. TURN server may be used for transferring video stream in case both peers are behind NAT. Example: turn:turn.example.com:3498

settings_schema.footer: * To report an issue, make a suggestion or a contribution, [check the repository](https://github.com/niklabh/mattermost-plugin-webrtc-video).
